alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 05 at 11:23PM CDT until May 06 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Custer County in central Nebraska... * Until midnight CDT. * At 1123 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles west of Sargent to near Ansley to near Sumner, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Broken Bow, Sargent, Ansley, Mason City, Oconto, Comstock, Berwyn, Weissert, Westerville, Lillian, Round Valley, Walworth, Arcadia Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Burr Oak, Gavin Siding, Wescott, Intersection of Highway 183 and Cumro Road, Buckeye, Block Hill Basin and Pressey State Wildlife Management Area. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 73 and 121. Highway 2 between mile markers 273 and 307. Highway 92 between mile markers 300 and 308. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
